DIV1.HEAD: By His Excellency Richard Earl of Bellomont, Captain General and Governour in Chief of his Majesties Province of New-York, and Territories depending thereon in America, & Vice-Admiral of the same. A PROCLAMATION
DIV1.P: WHereas in the Moneth of November last past, one Henry Mnd, Commander of a Merchant Ship, called, The John Hopewell of London, had his Ship Pyratically plundered upon the Coast of Guinea, by one Henry King, a notorious Pirate, who formerly used the Pennsilvania Trade. At the same time there did revolt and run away with him Nicholas Gilebrand, , Leonard Rawlins, Edward Atterberry, Emanuel, a Portaguese, John Saunders, VVilliam Parker of Sunderland, John Haus. Francis Brown, a Negro, all Marriners belonging to the said Ship John Hopewell of London, whereof the said Henry Commander. And whereas it is supposed that several of the said Pyrates are lurking some where within this and the Provinces I have therefore thought fit, by and with the Advice of his Majesties Council, to issue this my Proclamation. all the Majors, Alder-men, Justices of the Peace, Sheriffs, Constables, and all other of his Majesties Subjects, in their several and respective Cities, Counties, Towns, Jurisdictions, Franchises and Precincts within this Province, that they do in their several and respective Stations, take effectual care for the Apprehending & Securing and every of the above-named Pyrates, if any of them shall be found within their respective places aforesaid, and them to commit to Goal, so that they may receive such Condign Pu∣nishment as the Law directs. And for the better encouraging of the apprehending and securing of the aforesaid Pyrates, I do further, by and with the Advice aforesaid, Publish and Declare, That whatever Person or Persons apprehend and secure any of the afore∣said Pyrates, in order to their being brought to Condign Punishment, as aforesaid, that he or they shall so appre∣hend and secure, receive the Reward of Ten Pound current Money of this Province, and the Sum of Thirty Pounds current Money for the apprehending and securing of the said Henry King, to be paid by his Majesties Receiver General for the time being. And all his Majesties good Subjects are hereby required to take Notice hereof acordingly.

CLOSER.DATELINE: Given at Fort William Henry the 26th Day of July, in the Twelfth Year of the Reign of our Soveraign Lord WILLIAM the Third, by the Grace of God King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. Anno{que} Domine, 1700.

DIV1.P: Printed by W. Bradford, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Majesty in New-York, 1700.
